episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a shooting simulator at a political conference, the unique sounds of comets, the Nobel Prize ceremony's quirky traditions, and the recovery of stolen Van Gogh paintings linked to a cocaine cartel.

facts.fact: One of the stalls at the Conservative Party conference this week is a grounds shooting simulator.
Comets sound like a cross between a cat and a dolphin.
Nobel Prize winners always immediately return their award so they don't lose it in the subsequent party.
Two recently recovered stolen Van Gogh paintings would buy you enough cocaine that you could snort a continuous line from here to Moscow.
